summary: Turmeric is a plant from the ginger family, native to South Asia. It's known for its bright orange-yellow spice, made from its dried and ground rhizomes (underground stems). This spice is commonly used in Asian cooking, giving curries their distinctive color and flavor. The main active compound, curcumin, is approved as a food additive worldwide. While it's been used in traditional medicine, there's no strong scientific evidence yet to prove its medical benefits.
title: Turmeric
